briefTitle: Evaluation of Ceftaroline Fosamil Versus Vancomycin Plus Aztreonam in the Treatment of Patients With Skin Infections
officialTitle: A Phase III, Multicentre, Randomised, Double-Blind Comparative Study to Evaluate the Efficacy and Safety of Ceftaroline Fosamil (600 mg Every 8 Hours) Versus Vancomycin Plus Aztreonam in the Treatment of Patients With Complicated Bacterial Skin and Soft Tissue Infections With Evidence of Systemic Inflammatory Response or Underlying Comorbidities
conditions: Complicated Skin and Soft Tissue Infection
summary: The purpose of this study is to evaluate the effects of Ceftaroline Fosamil versus Vancomycin plus Aztreonam in treatment of patients with complicated bacterial skin and soft tissue infections.

primaryOutcome.measure: Clinical Response at Test of Cure (TOC) in Modified Intent-to-treat (MITT) Analysis Set
primaryOutcome.timeFrame: 7 to 20 days after the last dose of study drug
